intro: Ranunculus lerchenfeldianus, commonly known as the Lerchenfeld's buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to South Africa. It features showy, double-flowered blooms in shades of yellow and orange, with a distinctive central pistil. The plant has finely divided, trifoliate leaves that are hairy and arranged alternately along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its botanical characteristics include a short, stout rhizome and a long flowering period from late spring to early autumn.
